snippet: Fiat Chrysler is expected to pay the government as much as $70 million for underreporting the number of death and injury claims tied to defects in its cars.
abstract: Fiat Chrysler will reportedly pay National Highway Traffic Safety Administration up to $70 million in fines for significantly underreporting number of death and injury claims tied to potential defects in its cars.

byline.original: By DANIELLE IVORY and BILL VLASIC

lead_paragraph: Fiat Chrysler is expected to pay the government as much as $70 million for underreporting the number of death and injury claims tied to defects in its cars.

headline.main: Regulator Is Said to Fine Fiat Chrysler $70 Million
headline.print_headline: Regulator Is Said to Fine Fiat Chrysler $70 Million
